title: 108_hr5182
content: The Homeland Security Civil Rights and Civil Liberties Protection Act of 2004 ensures that civil rights and liberties are not compromised in homeland security efforts. It also establishes an Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties within the Department of Homeland Security. Section 705(a) of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to ensure reporting directly to the Secretary, addressing concerns of profiling based on race, ethnicity, or religion, and assisting in developing and reviewing department policies. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to ensure the protection of civil rights and civil liberties in Department programs and activities, overseeing compliance with relevant requirements, and coordinating with other officials on related policies and procedures. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to ensure the protection of civil rights and civil liberties in Department programs and activities. This includes coordinating with other officials to address civil rights, civil liberties, and privacy considerations in an integrated manner, providing appropriate reports to Congress, and investigating complaints of possible abuses unless determined otherwise by the Inspector General. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to protect civil rights and civil liberties through the Office of Inspector General. This includes designating a senior official to oversee these efforts. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to designate a senior official within the Office of Inspector General to coordinate investigations of abuses of civil rights and civil liberties within the Department of Homeland Security and its contractors. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 designates a senior official to coordinate investigations of civil rights and civil liberties abuses within the Department of Homeland Security and its contractors. This official is responsible for initiating investigations, ensuring personnel receive proper training, and consulting with the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties regarding alleged abuses. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 designates a senior official to coordinate investigations of civil rights and civil liberties abuses within the Department of Homeland Security. This official consults with the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties, provides information on investigation outcomes, and refers matters not investigated to the Officer for further action. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 designates a senior official to coordinate investigations of civil rights and civil liberties abuses within the Department of Homeland Security. The official refers matters not investigated to the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties, ensures public access to information on filing complaints, and reports weaknesses within the Department related to civil rights or civil liberties. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 designates a senior official to coordinate investigations of civil rights and civil liberties abuses within the Department of Homeland Security. The official must report weaknesses, problems, and deficiencies related to civil rights or civil liberties to the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties. The official must report weaknesses, problems, and deficiencies related to civil rights or civil liberties to the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties. Sec. 813 protects civil rights and civil liberties by the Office of Inspector General. SEC. 5 establishes a Privacy Officer. SEC. 5 of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 establishes a Privacy Officer who reports directly to the Secretary. The Privacy Officer coordinates with the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties to ensure that programs, policies, and procedures involving civil rights, civil liberties, and privacy are addressed comprehensively and that appropriate reports are provided to Congress.
